subject: Marketing
title: The Framing Effect
description: A quick, practical guide to The Framing Effect.

hook.text: Beef labeled '95% lean' outsells identical beef labeled '5% fat' by a wide margin.

buildup.text: Same product. Different words. Completely different customer perception.

discovery.text: Framing means how you present information matters more than the information itself.

twist.text: 'Save $50' and 'Avoid losing $50' trigger different brain regions despite being identical.

climax.text: Every marketing message is a frame. Choosing the right one is the entire craft.

punchline.text: Same facts, different frame, different choice.

quiz.question: What does the framing effect demonstrate?
options: Presentation of information matters more than the information itself
Consumers always prefer positively worded labels
Price is the only factor that influences buying decisions
